title: Hey Riot, why is this a thing

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Pic is in the link

So, traditional logic would lead us to believe that if I try to use a thing that "Switches positions" either I don't switch and I get caught, or I switch and don't get caught. But in this situation and often happens when people get melee'd through flashes, that Riot's system leaves you in two places at one when you teleport.

Fix it at some point please, this is pretty crappy mechanics

replies.body:
The melee auto attack through flashes is actually an entirely separate issue to the "being in two places at once" bug. 

I strongly recommend you check out [**DTM**'s post](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/HZ4wirXv-melee-attacks-being-uninterrupted-by-flash-is-counter-intuitive-for-both-sides-of-the-fight?comment=0001) on the melee auto-attack and flash interaction. He does a great job at explaining the background and logic behind that interaction.

But otherwise you're definitely right, being in two places at once after a dash is a terrible interaction that's been around for a while now. I don't think it's an easy fix though, it will most likely require re-coding how the game detects your position.
yes the coding would need to be remade pretty much from the ground up, as s much stuff is intertwined they cannot efficiently change the code without causing major problems otherwise.
I've done it a lot and it's because the opponent always manages to flash as the auto is being executed right after the initial gap where it can be cancelled (If that makes sense).

I agree, if you use a blink/switch/teleport/dash, either you get away and the ability goes on cooldown, or you don't get away and it is unable to activate.

I also believe that if you put a certain distance between yourself an a melee auto attack, the auto should miss. _(and ranged attack animations should be canceled, UNLESS the projectile is mid flight, in which case it should still hit you.)_
